comments:
3.2M5, with a completely fresh workspace, attempting to import a team project set always results in this stack trace, even if it's the very first thing I do:

Created an attachment (id=35019)
test Team Project Set file

Attaching a .psf that gives me trouble.
This was caused by a change in the modify rule for projects.
*** Bug 128718 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 128775 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Was a regression test added for this?  It seems like a pretty basic capability to have broken.  It easily could be the very first thing a developer tries with Eclipse (it was for a new developer on my project).
No but you are right that we should. I have entered bug 129011 for this.
*** Bug 129131 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I've found the "load projects from map files" does not work either, with similar exception. Can you add a JUnit test for that too :) ... It causes me to not be able to use the M5 platform. Well ... to load the projects in a workspace ... then I guess I'll switch back. 

Is a -dev patch possible (and easy for you to point me too?)
The problem was fixed in the integration build following M5. You should be able to grab the org.eclipse.team.cvs.core plugin from that build.
*** Bug 130387 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 130723 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

(In reply to comment #10)
> The problem was fixed in the integration build following M5. You should be able
> to grab the org.eclipse.team.cvs.core plugin from that build.
> 
Which build do you mean? I tried M5a (I20060223-1656) and I am having the same problems.

(In reply to comment #13)
I'll answer my own question :-)

If you get the plugin from driver I20060228-1207 it will work.
*** Bug 131675 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
